translated: “All this is done in the end,
both do not see the Dhamma;

analyzed: ubho pakatiyā cutā  yaḥ ca ayam mantet hāpayeti
translated: both have died naturally,🔽he who recites the mantras and
therefore I do not serve this,
the Dhamma served by the seers.”
“Wander, great one, the world is wide,
like a pot that’s been thrown away.
Shame on that gain of fame,
and that gain of wealth, brahmin;
The Chavaka Birth Story is the ninth.
